title: problem accessing ftp server using external storage
body: ### expected behaviour owncloud should load all external ftp files in the web interface no matter how big the files are. perhaps it shouldn't enter extended passive mode. ### actual behaviour i can navigate through folders in the owncloud web interface but when loading any files bigger than 50kb it won't load in owncloud and just says 503 service unavailable. ftp server says it enters into extended passive mode and then it fails. ### steps to reproduce 1. refer this topic: http://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=17462 2. create an ftp server mount 3. try enter into it when files of reasonable size are present ~ 1mb-2gb. 4. error page appears with 503 service unavailable. ### server configuration operating system: linux hosting package web server: apache on litespeed database: sqlite php version: 5.3.26 owncloud version: 5.0.12 ### client configuration browser: chrome 30.0.1599.101 m or ie10 operating system: windows 7 ### logs #### owncloud admin page ``` oc\files\storage\common::getmimetype() [oc\files\storage\common.getmimetype]: ftp server error 426:426 connection closed; transfer aborted. at /clientdata/apache-www/ftp/lib/files/storage/common.php#0 ```
